By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

UGM: YUSU to support reform

There has been contention this week over a UGM motion for YUSU to advocate reform of the Westminster electoral system

Coppers on Campus

Sam Lawson talks to Jon-Mark Buchanan, Police Community Officer (PCO) for the University of York and Heslington, about campus' safety and what he is doing to improve it (Thumbnail credit Image: North Yorkshire Police)

First ever YUSU awards night

The first YUSU awards night is to take place in Week 8 of this term on Saturday 19 June

Financier turned author to give talk

Alex Buchanan, the highly acclaimed author of the The Game: How the City Really Works is to give a talk at the University of York

Two York scientists made royal fellows

Two member of the University of York Chemistry department have been elected fellows of the Royal Society, one of the top honours for science in the world

YUSU by-election results announced

The results have been announced this afternoon for the YUSU by-election

Fire in Vanbrugh F Block

A fire, which originated in the New Vanbrugh F Block, resulted in the fire brigade being called out last night at around 9.30pm

Goodricke College residents face mains power cut

Plans for a complete eight hour mains power cut across Heslington East on Monday 17 May have been announced today, affecting 166 Goodricke College residents (Thumbnail credit Kenneth Dixon Court, Photo: DS Pugh)

YUSU website unable to cope with demand for 'SinneD'

YUSU have been criticised today, following the failure of their website to cope with the demand for SinneD tickets, this year's Big D event

York Hornets win BCA Midlands competition

University of York cheerleaders, the York Hornets, have achieved first place at The BCA (British Cheerleading Association) Midlands Classic competition, beating 18 other squads to the title

Conservatives win York Outer

The constituency of York Outer, in which the University of York lies, has today been won by the Conservative Party candidate, Julian Sturdy

Kids' Camp 'saved'

It has been revealed today that the YUSU trustee board has accepted a proposal for the continuation of Kid's Camp for the next few years.

Big D 'SinneD' promo video launched

The official Big D 'SinneD' trailer has today been launched at can be seen on <em>Nouse</em>

Tru sold by Luminar group

Tru nightclub has been closed by Luminar group and will be closed on Tuesdays "for the foreseeable future"

Tuition fee cap removal leaked

Tuition fees could rise from their the current level of PS3,225 up to PS14,000, depending on the outcome of this week's parliamentary election

Second student suicide this academic year

A third-year student, Thomas Robinson, was found hanged at his home in York on April 14

New government legislation leads to fears of 'student ghettoisation' in York

New government legislation plans will require student landlords to obtain planning permission before renovating family homes into student houses in residential York areas, such as Badger Hill (Thumbnail credit Laws will prevent students from living in areas like Badger Hill. Photo: Maggie Aslet)

Adam Bennett advertises escort agency

The on-campus letting agency, Adam Bennett, has been accused of advertising escort services from its office above Costcutter (Thumbnail credit Nouse received a letter last month accusing Adam Bennett of advertsing escort services on campus. Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

University error forces nurses to pay double rent

For the second year running, the University has been strongly criticised for giving misleading information to nursing students, causing many of them to have to pay over PS1,500 extra rent over the summer (Thumbnail credit Many nurses will have to pay over PS1,500 in double rent this year. Image: Flickr)

NUS President-elect Aaron Porter to fight against lift on tuition fees cap

In an exclusive interview with <em>Nouse</em>, NUS President-elect, Aaron Porter, has emphasised that his top priority this year will be to reject "any possible lifting of the cap on fees" and to "fight for a fairer alternative" (Thumbnail credit Aaron Porter rose from the position of Vice-President for Higher Education to President of NUS last month. Image: CBI Higher Education Summit)

YUSU consensus that we 'need' the NUS despite recognition of alienation

YUSU's affiliation to the National Union of Students (NUS) is viewed by YUSU Officers with varying degrees of content

York accommodation fees rise up to 16 per cent above NUS calculations

Earlier this year the National Union of Students (NUS) reported a 22% rise in accommodation costs since the academic year of 2006-2007 (Thumbnail credit Accommodation charges, such as at Alcuin, have risen by up to 38%. Photo: Michael Brunsden)

NUS: 1 in 7 female students sexually assaulted

One in seven female students has been the victim of serious sexual assault or serious physical violence while at university, says a recent National Union of Students (NUS) report

Audio Bullys revealed as headliners of Big D

The annual campus festival, Big D, is to be headlined by Audio Bullys and Chase & Status this year (Thumbnail credit Audio Bullys and Chase &amp; Status will headline this years Big D, along with Reverend Soundsystem. Images: Facebook)

Asbestos in V-Bar prevents new URY equipment

It has been revealed that asbestos present in the walls of V-Bar has caused a halt to plans to install speakers to stream University Radio York (URY) across the space (Thumbnail credit Asbestos has been forced to halt plans to install new speakers. Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Plan for student centre confirmed

The University of York have drafted a Space Strategy plan, outlining the direction in which they would like the University develop in ten or more years time (Thumbnail credit A new student centre is part of the University's Space Strategy. Photo: Sam Newsome)

York scientists make new environmental breakthroughs

Scientists at the University of York have been embarking on a number of new environmental initiatives, which could help reduce the impact of carpet tile waste on the environment and create an alternative biofuel made from household waste (Thumbnail credit Scientists have made new findings. Image: York Press)

YUSU Strategic Plan

Excited you probably aren't, but interested you should be. After months of consultation, Union President Tim Ngwena has released the draft version of YUSU's strategic plan for 2010-2013, claiming that the report "sets the framework for making the right decision in the future."

Confusion over 'No Platform' policies

The University and the National Union of Students (NUS) have conflicted over whether British National Party (BNP) speakers should be permitted on campus

Computer Science Professor awarded

University of York Computer Science Professor, Samuel Braunstein, has been placed number five in the list of the 'Top Ten Physics Newsmakers of the Decade', by the American Physical Society

UGM: YUSU to support reform

There has been contention this week over a UGM motion for YUSU to advocate reform of the Westminster electoral system
